welcome.data: Warm-up prompt: “What do you already know about how websites are structured?” Students write 1–2 sentences.

aim.data: State agenda and objective: Understand HTML structure and create a basic HTML page in WebStorm.

review.data: Ask students what tools were installed last class and their purpose. Recap file management and HTML basics.

relevant.data: Live coding in WebStorm: Introduce HTML structure (<!DOCTYPE>, <html>, <head>, <body>) and demonstrate file creation and preview.

interactive.data: Students build their own HTML page in WebStorm with headings and paragraphs.

ownership.data: Students customize their page and push to GitHub. Add headings and related content about themselves.

resonate.data: Exit ticket: Explain the role of the <head> tag and how it differs from <body>. Share takeaways.

supplies.data: Computers with WebStorm, internet, projector, GitHub accounts, exit ticket method.
